maml:Description.maml:para: You apply dns records to individual zones or to the whole organization. If you pass ZoneID it will be targeted otherwise the currently loaded zone from Set-CFCurrentZone is targeted.
Type of record to modify.
name of the record to modify.
DNS record value write.
Time to live, optional update setting. Default is 120.
Set or unset orange cloud mode for a record. Optional.

What is this rule going to do? Options include whitelist, block, challenge, js_challenge. Default is to whitelist.

maml:description.maml:para: Connects to the CloudFlare API for future requests.
Connects to the CloudFlare API for future requests.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Cloudflare API token.
The associated email address with this Cloudflare API token.
The Cloudflare API token.
The associated email address with this Cloudflare API token.
If you pass ZoneID it will be targeted otherwise the currently loaded zone from Set-CFCurrentZone is targeted.
A Cloudflare ID for the record.
Record type to retrieve. If no value is passed all types will be enumerated.
DNS record name. If not passed then all records will be returned.
Maximum results returned per page. Default is 50.
Order the results by type, name, content, ttl, or proxied. Default is name.
Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
Match either 'any' or 'all' the supplied matching parameters passed to this function. Default is all.
If you pass ZoneID it will be targeted otherwise the currently loaded zone from Set-CFCurrentZone is targeted.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows all DNS records in the current zone

maml:Description.maml:para: You apply firewall rules to individual zones or to the whole organization. If you pass ZoneID it will be targeted otherwise the currently loaded zone from Set-CFCurrentZone is targeted.
This can be an IP, IP range (Cidr notation), ASN (AS####), or 2 letter Country code if matching by Target in your search. Default is null (match all items).
Are you matching an IP, IP_Range, ASN, or Country?
Matches only firewall rules with this mode. Options include whitelist, block, challenge, js_challenge. Default is null (match all modes)
Order the results by configuration_target, configuration_value, or mode. Default is configuration_value
Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
Match either 'any' or 'all' the supplied matching parameters passed to this function. Default is all.
Maximum results returned per page. Default is 50.
You apply firewall rules to individual zones or to the whole organization. If you pass ZoneID it will be targeted otherwise the currently loaded zone from Set-CFCurrentZone is targeted.
This can be an IP, IP range (Cidr notation), ASN (AS####), or 2 letter Country code if matching by Target in your search. Default is null (match all items).
Are you matching an IP, IP_Range, ASN, or Country?
Matches only firewall rules with this mode. Options include whitelist, block, challenge, js_challenge. Default is null (match all modes)
Order the results by configuration_target, configuration_value, or mode. Default is configuration_value
Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
Match either 'any' or 'all' the supplied matching parameters passed to this function. Default is all.
Maximum results returned per page. Default is 50.

maml:Description.maml:para: You apply WAF rules to individual zones or to the whole organization. If you pass ZoneID it will be targeted otherwise the currently loaded zone from Set-CFCurrentZone is targeted.
Maximum results returned per page. Default is 50.
Package ID to query. If not supplied then all package IDs are queried.
Group ID to query. If not supplied then all group IDs are queried.
Description to query for.
WAF mode to query for. Can be whitelist, block, challenge, or js_challenge. Default is all modes.
WAF priority to query for. Default is all priorities.
Order the results by configuration_target, configuration_value, or mode. Default is configuration_value
Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
Match either 'any' or 'all' the supplied matching parameters passed to this function. Default is all.

WAF priority to query for. Default is all priorities.

Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
Match either 'any' or 'all' the supplied matching parameters passed to this function. Default is all.
Maximum results returned per page. Default is 50.

rule group name. If not supplied then all rule groups are returned.

Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
Match either 'any' or 'all' the supplied matching parameters passed to this function. Default is all.
Maximum results returned per page. Default is 50.

Return results in asc (ascending) or dec (decending) order. Default is asc.
